author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Hello, 1) I have updated the compat entry of Documenter and deleted Plots 2) I am able to import RoadRunner and can add the package from this git website. Please see the attached picture. I am afraid the AutoMerge does not go through because this package is only applicable to windows 64 due to the Dynamic-link library files (libantimony.dll and roadrunner_c_api.dll under /src), which is necessary. Hope to have your approval soon. Thanks in advance. Jin
Okay, you should probably look into using BinaryBuilder instead of including the binaries in the source repo like that.
Also, did you intend to register a fork of a fork?

Thank you. I will look into the BinaryBuilder. Yes, it is a folk of a folk. I can not add an issue from my github, but can only add one from an organization. The original person who started this project is not working on it anymore.

Hello, 
The compat entries are updated again. 
I have difficulties to build our specific software (https://github.com/sys-bio/roadrunner/wiki/Building-from-Source) by BinaryBuilder. Do you have other suggessions? Is it ok to just use the dll files in the folder /src? Please see my previous comments for details, if necessary. Thanks in advance.
There are errors when I built by BinaryBuilder may be because the building process of our specific software is quite sensitive.
@giordano Many thanks for your suggessions. I will try it.

@giordano @fredrikekre My package finally has passed the auto merge. I appreciate for your comments and help. Could you please help merge it? Or I have to wait for auto merge?  Thanks in advance. [noblock]
